Label: L-arginine supplementation in healthy young men led to better exercise performance by increasing blood nitrite levels, lowering blood pressure, reducing the effort needed for moderate exercise, and allowing them to exercise longer at high intensity.,The study found that taking L-Citrulline supplements can help healthy adult men perform better in intense cycling exercises, breathe more efficiently, and lower their blood pressure, while L-Arginine supplements did not show similar benefits.,The study demonstrates that L-arginine supplementation significantly improved pain-free walking distance in patients with intermittent claudication, indicating a reduction in pain associated with peripheral arterial occlusive disease.,lthough the study indicates that L-citrulline supplementation raises plasma L-arginine concentration and augments nitric oxide (NO)-dependent signaling, which could theoretically influence exercise performance, the study does not specifically measure or report on direct exercise performance outcomes. The lack of improvement in flow-mediated vasodilation (FMD) over baseline suggests no direct evidence of improved exercise performance as measured in this study. However, the correlation between an increase in arginine/ADMA ratio and improvement of FMD suggests a potential but not directly measured benefit to aspects of vascular function that could theoretically influence exercise performance.,Giving well-trained male college judo athletes arginine supplements for a short time increased their blood arginine levels, but didn't improve their exercise performance or the way their body processed nitric oxide, lactate, and ammonia during intense short-term exercise.,Taking an AAKG supplement before resistance exercises, like bench press and leg press, did not improve strength or the amount of weight lifted for both trained and untrained men, compared to taking a placebo. Heart rate was also the same after the exercise, whether they took the supplement or the placebo.,Oral L-arginine supplementation led to a statistically significant increase in nitric oxide (NO) concentration and total antioxidant status (TAS) level.,So, while the study does not directly measure nitric oxide levels, the significant increase in cGMP serves as a strong indicator of enhanced nitric oxide production or activity due to L-arginine supplementation.,This improvement is shown by the increased levels of superoxide dismutase (SOD), an index of antioxidant capacity (P < 0.01), suggesting a reduction in oxidative stress. L-arginine supplementation, therefore, seems to have a beneficial effect on oxidative stress in this patient group.,Taking arginine asparate for four weeks, in either high or low doses, showed no change in performance, hormone levels, or metabolic measures for male athletes.,. In fact, patients who took L-arginine did not improve as much as those taking a placebo in terms of their walking distance without pain.

The consumption of BM was associated with a reduction in salivary cortisol levels, indicating a potential stress-reducing effect of the supplement.,B. monnieri extract significantly reduced cortisol levels in the mouse model, particularly in response to stress induced by lipopolysaccharide (LPS). This finding indicates a statistically significant positive benefit of the extract in reducing cortisol, a stress hormone.

,The selected studies suggested that the plant extracts were able to show some improvements in healthy subjects which were determined in Auditory Verbal Learning Task, digit span-reverse test, inspection time task and working memory, even though it was not significant, as no two studies found statistically significant changes in the same two tests.,. B. monnieri in a cocktail with other plant extracts were able to significantly reduce the effects of Alzheimer's disease, and depression which cannot be solely credited as the effect of B. monnieri. Although in one study B. monnieri was able to potentiate the beneficial effects of citalopram; on the whole, currently, there are only limited studies to establish the memory-enhancing and neuroprotective effects of B. monnieri. ,. Both the beta-alanine (BA) and placebo (PL) groups experienced elevated cortisol levels following exercise compared to baseline, but no significant differences were found between these two groups at any time point post-exercise.,The study demonstrates that creatine plus beta-alanine supplementation led to significantly greater improvements in lean body mass and percent body fat reduction, as well as strength enhancements, compared to either creatine alone or placebo.,Creatine improves muscle power and strength. Combining betaine with creatine also shows improvement, but not more than creatine alone. ,Betaine by itself doesn't make a difference in muscle power, strength, or body composition.,Only the combination of creatine and beta-alanine (CrBa) showed a significant time effect on some parameters, suggesting potential benefits of the combination, not beta-alanine alone.,In summary, the study suggests HIIT is an effective method to improve maximal oxygen uptake, but beta-alanine supplementation did not show additional benefits beyond the placebo in terms of VO2 peak.,betaA supplementation for 28 days enhanced sub-maximal endurance performance by delaying OBLA. However, betaA supplemented individuals had a reduced aerobic capacity as evidenced by the decrease in VO2max values post supplementation.,Combining beta-alanine supplements with short, intense workouts significantly improved endurance, the amount of work done, and muscle mass in young, active men, while those who only exercised and took a placebo did not see as much improvement.,The systematic review and meta-analysis of beta-alanine (BA) supplementation studies indicate a positive effect on physical performance in aerobic-anaerobic transition zones. Specifically, there was a small but significant improvement in the Time Trial Test (TTT) and a large effect in the Limited Distance Test (LDT). These results suggest that BA supplementation can statistically improve exercise performance in these specific areas.,However, it also states that isometric endurance and 400-m race time were not affected by the supplementation. Therefore, while beta-alanine supplementation improved certain measures of exercise performance, it did not enhance overall exercise performance across all the tested parameters.,The abstract indicates that beta-alanine supplementation significantly improved dynamic knee extension torque during the fourth and fifth bouts of maximal voluntary knee extensions, suggesting a benefit in specific aspects of exercise performance related to fatigue resistance in repeated dynamic contractions.,Taking beta-alanine supplements increased muscle carnosine and made the athletes' muscles less tired during certain exercises, but it didn’t help them run faster or improve endurance in holding a contraction.,In line with the purported mechanisms for an ergogenic effect of β-alanine supplementation, exercise lasting 60-240 s was improved (P=0.001) in BA compared to Pla, as was exercise of >240 s (P=0.046). In contrast, there was no benefit of β-alanine on exercise lasting <60 s (P=0.312). The median effect of β-alanine supplementation is a 2.85% (-0.37 to 10.49%) improvement in the outcome of an exercise measure, when a median total of 179 g of β-alanine is supplemented.,β-Alanine supplementation helped college wrestlers and football players perform better and gain more muscle during 8 weeks of intense training compared to those who didn’t take the supplement. Football players saw the most improvement.,β-alanine supplementation elevated muscle carnosine content by 45.3% in soleus and 28.2% in gastrocnemius, and improved the 2,000-m rowing performance of the elite rowers by 4.3 seconds.,beta-alanine supplementation appears to have a minimal or unclear effect on swimming performance in real-world training and competition settings, both in terms of actual performance times and physiological markers in the blood.,5 weeks of beta-alanine supplementation showed no improvement in repeat sprint performance, including peak and mean horizontal power. There were no significant differences in the level of fatigue between the groups. Blood lactate values remained unchanged before and after supplementation in both groups.,Testosterone concentrations did not change with supplementation. No differences were observed in the acute endocrine response (growth hormone and cortisol concentrations) to the exercise stimulus between the beta-alanine and placebo groups.

Label: Citrulline malate supplementation, at a single 6 g dose pre-workout, does not provide a statistically significant benefit in terms of improving muscle recovery or altering cortisol levels after a session of high-intensity resistance exercise in untrained young adult men. ,Taking Citrulline-malate helped college guys do more chin-ups, reverse chin-ups, and push-ups, and it changed their diastolic blood pressure a bit, but it didn’t do anything for their blood lactate, heart rate, or systolic blood pressure.,Citrulline/Malate supplementation led to a significant 49.8% intra-group decrease and a 60.7% between-group decrease in blood lactate levels, particularly noticeable immediately after exercise, suggesting a potential enhancement in athletic performance and delayed onset of fatigue during excessive or prolonged activity.,Taking citrulline malate helps in doing more repetitions during lower-body exercises, but it doesn’t make a difference in blood lactate, heart rate, or blood pressure compared to not taking it.,The study tested if l-citrulline could help young and older adults use oxygen better while walking. It helped young men use oxygen more quickly when they started exercising, but it didn’t make a difference for women or older adults.,the study demonstrated that L-citrulline supplementation impacted Nitric Oxide (NO) levels. Specifically, the supplementation led to a significant increase in serum nitrogen oxide (NOx, which includes nitrite plus nitrate and is a marker of NO production) in the L-citrulline group (p<0.05).,: L-citrulline-malate supplementation appears to have had a positive impact on certain metabolic parameters related to exercise performance. The supplementation significantly increased the plasma concentrations of citrulline, arginine, ornithine, urea, creatinine, and nitrite (p < 0.05), which are involved in the metabolic handling of amino acids and the production of arginine-derived metabolites. These changes suggest enhanced amino acid utilization and increased production of metabolites beneficial for exercise performance. Additionally, growth hormone increase was higher in the supplemented group post-exercise (p < 0.05), indicating a potential enhancement in exercise-related hormonal response. These factors collectively suggest a positive effect of L-citrulline-malate supplementation on exercise performance, particularly in the context of endurance cycling.,The study found that taking L-Citrulline supplements can help healthy adult men perform better in intense cycling exercises, breathe more efficiently, and lower their blood pressure, while L-Arginine supplements did not show similar benefits.,Acute CM supplementation in recreationally active males provides no ergogenic benefit in aerobic cycling performance followed by an anaerobic cycling test.,No significant positive benefits of citrulline malate supplementation on exercise performance, muscle swelling response, or subjective measures of focus, energy, and fatigue were observed.,The study found that neither Citrulline malate (CitMal) nor beetroot juice (BEET) supplementation enhanced performance during maximal isokinetic leg extension exercise, as all measured performance variables did not significantly differ with treatment (all p > 0.05).,Citrulline supplementation has a significant benefit compared to placebo in improving strength and power outcomes during high-intensity exercise involving multiple repetitive muscle actions of large muscle groups.,The abstract indicates that L-Citrulline supplementation significantly improved subjective feelings of concentration immediately after exercise. This suggests a positive impact on attention or mental focus as a result of the supplementation.,L-Citrulline supplementation significantly improved subjective feelings of muscle fatigue immediately after exercise, suggesting a beneficial effect on physical fatigue.,L-Citrulline supplementation significantly increased plasma L-arginine levels, reduced the cycling completion time by 1.5%, and improved subjective feelings of muscle fatigue and concentration immediately after exercise.,Citrulline supplementation led to significant decreases in serum levels of fasting blood sugar (FBS) and malondialdehyde (MDA). It also led to increased levels of total antioxidant capacity (TAC), citrulline, and nitrite/nitrate (NOx) when compared to the placebo group,In older female tennis players, taking Citrulline-malate (CM) before a match might help improve their grip strength and certain cycling performance aspects. However, it doesn't seem to affect their jumping power.,The supplementation led to an increase in ROS (Reactive Oxygen Species) production in polymorphonuclear neutrophils (PMNs) after exercise, followed by a decrease to levels lower than basal at recovery. Specifically, the supplementation led to a significant increase in serum nitrogen oxide (NOx, which includes nitrite plus nitrate and is a marker of NO production) in the L-citrulline group (p<0.05). These changes suggest enhanced amino acid utilization and increased production of metabolites beneficial for exercise performance. Additionally, growth hormone increase was higher in the supplemented group post-exercise (p < 0.05), indicating a potential enhancement in exercise-related hormonal response. The study demonstrates that supplementation with CoQ10, alpha-lipoic acid, and vitamin E decreased plasma lipid peroxides, increased CoQ10 concentration, and improved echocardiographic parameters in diabetic patients, indicating a beneficial effect on oxidative stress and related complications,While the study does not directly measure mitochondrial function, the observed effects of CoQ(10) on exercise-induced lactate production and VO(2) changes are indicative of improved mitochondrial efficiency in energy production during exercise. The decrease in gray matter choline-containing compounds (P < 0.05) could also imply a beneficial effect on brain metabolism, which is closely linked to mitochondrial function. However, the study did not demonstrate significant effects on other clinically relevant variables such as muscle strength or resting lactate levels, indicating that the improvement in mitochondrial function may be limited to specific areas.,Coenzyme Q(10) (CoQ(10)) treatment showed beneficial effects in terms of exercise performance in patients with mitochondrial cytopathy. The study reports that CoQ(10) treatment attenuated the rise in lactate after cycle ergometry and increased VO(2)/kg lean mass after 5 minutes of cycling (approximately 1.93 ml, P < 0.005). This indicates an improvement in aerobic capacity during exercise, suggesting a positive impact on exercise performance.,The study demonstrates that CoQ(10) supplementation led to a significant improvement in exercise performance, as evidenced by a 9% increase in peak VO(2) (a measure of aerobic exercise capacity), compared to placebo,. The study reports statistically significant improvements in peak VO(2) and O(2) pulse in the CoQ(10)-treated group compared to the placebo group, indicating enhanced exercise performance.,The study shows that CoQ(10) supplementation in patients with CAD resulted in statistically greater increases in endothelium-bound extracellular superoxide dismutase (ecSOD) activity compared to the placebo group. This suggests an improvement in oxidative stress management,Our results provide further evidence suggesting that CoQ10 supplementation is associated with alleviating oxidative stress,Eating a Mediterranean diet, especially when supplemented with CoQ, reduces oxidative stress after meals in elderly people, making it better for them compared to a diet rich in saturated fats.,Fatigue was significantly more common in the control group compared to the CoQ10 group (40.8% vs. 6.8%, p < 0.01). This suggests that CoQ10 supplementation resulted in a statistically significant improvement in reducing fatigue in patients.,The abstract indicates a significant reduction in oxidative stress markers, such as thiobarbituric acid reactive substances and malondialdehyde, in the CoQ10 group compared to the control group (p values not specified). Additionally, there was a significant increase in plasma vitamin E levels in the CoQ10 group, further supporting the reduction in oxidative stress.,This study showed beneficial effects of CoQ10 supplementation on inflammatory cytokines and oxidative stress in rheumatoid arthritis patients.,This study showed beneficial effects of CoQ10 supplementation on inflammatory cytokines and oxidative stress in rheumatoid arthritis patients.,The study found that CoQ10 supplementation improved oxidative stress in children with ASDs, as evidenced by changes in serum MDA, total antioxidant status (TAS), and antioxidant enzymes (SOD and GPx) activity.,The abstract indicates that high doses of CoQ10 improved sleep disorders in children with ASDs,Taking a combined supplement of nano-curcumin and CoQ10 significantly helps reduce the number, intensity, and length of migraine attacks and improves the quality of life for migraine patients without causing any side effects.,The abstract indicates that CoQ10 intake led to a significant reduction in protein carbonyl (PCO) levels (P < 0.001), which are markers of oxidative stress.,The abstract also shows that CoQ10 intake resulted in a significant reduction in serum interleukin 6 (IL-6) levels (P < 0.001), a marker of inflammation.,Taking CoQ10 for 8 weeks helped improve some signs of inflammation and oxidative stress in people with Bipolar disorder during their depressive times compared to those who took a placebo.,Taking CoQ10 for 8 weeks helped improve some signs of inflammation and oxidative stress in people with Bipolar disorder during their depressive times compared to those who took a placebo.,Coenzyme Q10 supplements at a dose of 150 mg can decrease oxidative stress and increase antioxidant enzyme activity in patients with CAD. ,Three-month supplementation with CoQ10 in OAT infertile men can attenuate oxidative stress in seminal plasma and improve semen parameters and antioxidant enzymes activity.,Oxidative Stress: Disagree

The study demonstrates that supplementation with CoQ10, alpha-lipoic acid, and vitamin E decreased plasma lipid peroxides, increased CoQ10 concentration, and improved echocardiographic parameters in diabetic patients, indicating a beneficial effect on oxidative stress and related complications (https://www.notion.so/The-study-demonstrates-that-supplementation-with-CoQ10-alpha-lipoic-acid-and-vitamin-E-decreased-p-0e7dd6bc8e2b422dae35a1dcd4f9b558?pvs=21), While the study does not directly measure mitochondrial function, the observed effects of CoQ(10) on exercise-induced lactate production and VO(2) changes are indicative of improved mitochondrial efficiency in energy production during exercise. The decrease in gray matter choline-containing compounds (P < 0.05) could also imply a beneficial effect on brain metabolism, which is closely linked to mitochondrial function. However, the study did not demonstrate significant effects on other clinically relevant variables such as muscle strength or resting lactate levels, indicating that the improvement in mitochondrial function may be limited to specific areas. Label: The study found that dark chocolate consumption significantly blunted cortisol reactivity to acute psychosocial stress compared to the placebo group. This indicates a statistically significant positive benefit of dark chocolate in moderating cortisol responses due to its flavonoid content.,Epicatechin-rich cocoa increased the protein and/or activity of mediators of biogenesis and cristae abundance, and improved skeletal muscle mitochondrial structure by enhancing cristae density.,While an increase in flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) and nitric oxide generation (NOx) can be indirectly associated with potential improvements in exercise performance due to better blood flow and vascular health, the study does not directly measure or report on exercise capacity, endurance, strength, or any other specific physical performance metrics.,The study indicates that dark chocolate intake in smokers significantly reduced oxidative stress. This is evidenced by the decrease in urinary isoprostanes and blood levels of soluble NOX2 derived peptide (sNOX2-dp), both markers of oxidative stress. Specifically, after dark chocolate consumption, there was a significant decrease in urinary isoprostanes and sNOX2-dp, demonstrating a reduction in oxidative stress.,In summary, the increased levels of NO in subjects who consumed dark chocolate could imply improved exercise performance due to enhanced blood flow, better oxygen and nutrient delivery to muscles, increased muscle efficiency, delayed fatigue, and improved recovery.,The study indicates that consumption of dark chocolate led to a significant increase in Nitric oxide (NO) serum levels in prehypertension subjects (from 7.70 ± 3.84 in the treatment group compared to 1.92(-0.79 ± 17.78) in the control group, p=0.001). Increased NO levels are associated with reduced oxidative stress, suggesting a beneficial effect in this regard.,The study shows that dark chocolate intake significantly reduced oxidative stress in peripheral artery disease (PAD) patients. This is evidenced by a decrease in serum isoprostanes (-23%; P=0.01) and sNOX2-dp (-37%; P<0.001), markers of oxidative stress.,The intake of dark chocolate led to a statistically significant improvement in exercise performance in PAD patients. This was demonstrated by an increase in maximal walking distance (MWD) by +11% (P<0.001) and maximal walking time (MWT) by +15% (P<0.001).,The study demonstrated that dark chocolate consumption significantly improved cardiovascular performance by increasing endothelial function, as evidenced by enhanced Flow-Mediated Dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery, and reducing wave reflections, shown by a decrease in the aortic augmentation index (AIx).,The study found no significant changes in plasma malondialdehyde (MDA) and total antioxidant capacity (TAC) after consuming dark chocolate,The study did not find significant differences in measures related to oxidative stress, such as resistance to LDL oxidation, total antioxidant capacity, or 8-isoprostanes, between high-flavonoid and low-flavonoid dark chocolate consumption. This indicates that the supplement did not statistically improve or benefit patient symptoms related to oxidative stress., Cocoa powder and dark chocolate may favorably affect cardiovascular disease decrease in lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) activity (-11%), which is a marker often associated with liver function, suggesting an improvement in this aspect.,The consumption of flavanol-containing milk 📏 Results: The study found that dark chocolate consumption significantly blunted cortisol reactivity to acute psychosocial stress compared to the placebo group. This indicates a statistically significant positive benefit of dark chocolate in moderating cortisol responses due to its flavonoid content. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-that-dark-chocolate-consumption-significantly-blunted-cortisol-reactivity-to-acute-p-42a6ba88304a4168b44bd9602e64b0c5?pvs=21), Epicatechin-rich cocoa increased the protein and/or activity of mediators of biogenesis and cristae abundance, and improved skeletal muscle mitochondrial structure by enhancing cristae density. (https://www.notion.so/Epicatechin-rich-cocoa-increased-the-protein-and-or-activity-of-mediators-of-biogenesis-and-cristae--b55a80057fa646f19f936878c9ab80eb?pvs=21), While an increase in flow-mediated dilatation (FMD) and nitric oxide generation (NOx) can be indirectly associated with potential improvements in exercise performance due to better blood flow and vascular health, the study does not directly measure or report on exercise capacity, endurance, strength, or any other specific physical performance metrics. (https://www.notion.so/While-an-increase-in-flow-mediated-dilatation-FMD-and-nitric-oxide-generation-NOx-can-be-indirec-e5f00d150f8144e08fe3690d7603f036?pvs=21), The study indicates that dark chocolate intake in smokers significantly reduced oxidative stress. This is evidenced by the decrease in urinary isoprostanes and blood levels of soluble NOX2 derived peptide (sNOX2-dp), both markers of oxidative stress. Specifically, after dark chocolate consumption, there was a significant decrease in urinary isoprostanes and sNOX2-dp, demonstrating a reduction in oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-indicates-that-dark-chocolate-intake-in-smokers-significantly-reduced-oxidative-stress-Th-e2f4a18f7cd846dd84eebfd096841012?pvs=21), In summary, the increased levels of NO in subjects who consumed dark chocolate could imply improved exercise performance due to enhanced blood flow, better oxygen and nutrient delivery to muscles, increased muscle efficiency, delayed fatigue, and improved recovery. (https://www.notion.so/In-summary-the-increased-levels-of-NO-in-subjects-who-consumed-dark-chocolate-could-imply-improved--b18c83bf106248b3b000932115f98121?pvs=21), The study indicates that consumption of dark chocolate led to a significant increase in Nitric oxide (NO) serum levels in prehypertension subjects (from 7.70 ± 3.84 in the treatment group compared to 1.92(-0.79 ± 17.78) in the control group, p=0.001). Increased NO levels are associated with reduced oxidative stress, suggesting a beneficial effect in this regard. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-indicates-that-consumption-of-dark-chocolate-led-to-a-significant-increase-in-Nitric-oxide-f236c9955a9b41409292993d3223eeba?pvs=21), The study shows that dark chocolate intake significantly reduced oxidative stress in peripheral artery disease (PAD) patients. This is evidenced by a decrease in serum isoprostanes (-23%; P=0.01) and sNOX2-dp (-37%; P<0.001), markers of oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-shows-that-dark-chocolate-intake-significantly-reduced-oxidative-stress-in-peripheral-arte-8fc795bb6ba74a449f265ee7f509fc30?pvs=21), The intake of dark chocolate led to a statistically significant improvement in exercise performance in PAD patients. This was demonstrated by an increase in maximal walking distance (MWD) by +11% (P<0.001) and maximal walking time (MWT) by +15% (P<0.001). (https://www.notion.so/The-intake-of-dark-chocolate-led-to-a-statistically-significant-improvement-in-exercise-performance--21cf96edc7394b30b1dc7dcea661654f?pvs=21), The study demonstrated that dark chocolate consumption significantly improved cardiovascular performance by increasing endothelial function, as evidenced by enhanced Flow-Mediated Dilation (FMD) of the brachial artery, and reducing wave reflections, shown by a decrease in the aortic augmentation index (AIx). (https://www.notion.so/The-study-demonstrated-that-dark-chocolate-consumption-significantly-improved-cardiovascular-perform-b938119d3b9240ea96bcf7f948460e89?pvs=21), The study found no significant changes in plasma malondialdehyde (MDA) and total antioxidant capacity (TAC) after consuming dark chocolate (https://www.notion.so/The-study-found-no-significant-changes-in-plasma-malondialdehyde-MDA-and-total-antioxidant-capacit-45c5653db65e4c1cb5cfcfb4cfcf8a17?pvs=21), The study did not find significant differences in measures related to oxidative stress, such as resistance to LDL oxidation, total antioxidant capacity, or 8-isoprostanes, between high-flavonoid and low-flavonoid dark chocolate consumption. This indicates that the supplement did not statistically improve or benefit patient symptoms related to oxidative stress. (https://www.notion.so/The-study-did-not-find-significant-differences-in-measures-related-to-oxidative-stress-such-as-resi-c83d5f21f022493a9666b5365c2babfe?pvs=21),  Cocoa powder and dark chocolate may favorably affect cardiovascular disease risk status by modestly reducing LDL oxidation susceptibility, increasing serum total antioxidant capacity and HDL-cholesterol concentrations, and not adversely affecting prostaglandins. Label: Ten patients using Doloteffin (PAID) and five using rofecoxib (NSAID) reported no pain without additional rescue medication for at least 5 days in the 6th week. Eighteen PAID and twelve NSAID patients had a reduction of over 50% in their weekly average pain scores between weeks 1 and 6.,Doloteffin significantly reduced the requirement for NSAIDs in the back patient group over time. Between 50% and 70% of the patients benefitted from Doloteffin., The follow-up showed diary pain scores with the respective percentages with no, mild, moderate, severe, and excruciating pain being 28%, 39%, 22%, 8.5%, and 1.5%, respectively. Few patients requested additional treatments for their pain.

📏 Results: There were no significant changes in cortisol levels among the groups (FO, ISO, placebo) in response to the supplementation or post-exercise. (https://www.notion.so/There-were-no-significant-changes-in-cortisol-levels-among-the-groups-FO-ISO-placebo-in-response-c70fe111d6b4405a89507c0197b291fd?pvs=21), Depression symptoms did not significantly reduce in studies using supplements with pure docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) or those with supplements containing over 50% DHA. Omega3 LC-PUFA supplementation did not show significant improvement in mild-to-moderate depression, chronic fatigue, and non-clinical populations. (https://www.notion.so/Depression-symptoms-did-not-significantly-reduce-in-studies-using-supplements-with-pure-docosahexaen-059507b7764246e7866aa6e4bba5c70d?pvs=21),  Taking omega-3 fatty acids and synthetic vitamin E can increase their levels in your blood, but they don't seem to change your blood fats, inflammation markers or the way your white blood cells respond to inflammation. (https://www.notion.so/Taking-omega-3-fatty-acids-and-synthetic-vitamin-E-can-increase-their-levels-in-your-blood-but-they-8f3a02d81cd740ea8816e76ca4a1b20e?pvs=21), Agree. The study found that fish oil supplementation increased PBMC IL-2 production (P=0.0067) and NK cell activity (P=0.0163) 3 hours post-exercise compared to the control group, indicating a beneficial effect on certain aspects of the immune response, which can be related to inflammation. (https://www.notion.so/Agree-The-study-found-that-fish-oil-supplementation-increased-PBMC-IL-2-production-P-0-0067-and-N-48938a96a7bf4ac5bfa5e56184f5cb24?pvs=21), EPA/DHA supplementation increases blood levels of these fatty acids and results in decreased resting levels of inflammatory biomarkers in exercise-trained men, but does not appear necessary for exercise-induced attenuation in either inflammation or oxidative stress.  (https://www.notion.so/EPA-DHA-supplementation-increases-blood-levels-of-these-fatty-acids-and-results-in-decreased-resting-6526a0805a57432bb3f2f31f72ec13a8?pvs=21),  Fish oil alone also had some benefits but did not improve fitness and body composition. (https://www.notion.so/Fish-oil-alone-also-had-some-benefits-but-did-not-improve-fitness-and-body-composition-5404f6990f0f43c4b761e6f2d69f3c2d?pvs=21), No effect of DHA-rich fish oil on power output during maximal 6s cycle sprinting, during 5-minute time trial, or maximal voluntary contraction force. (https://www.notion.so/No-effect-of-DHA-rich-fish-oil-on-power-output-during-maximal-6s-cycle-sprinting-during-5-minute-ti-89b3af77c8284041af3c2dd9cfcf625e?pvs=21), Taking DHA-rich fish oil for 8 weeks made the male cyclists use oxygen more efficiently during intense cycling but didn't make them pedal any harder or faster. The variability in results, depending on the preparation of glucosamine and the quality of the studies, highlights the need for more consistent research in this area.,Trials showed moderate to large effects of glucosamine and chondroitin preparations in alleviating osteoarthritis symptoms.,• Overall Effect on Function: The study showed a 21% improvement in function using the Lequesne index across all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: Similar to pain, glucosamine in the Rotta preparation was more effective in improving joint function compared to placebo, as opposed to non-Rotta preparations.
• WOMAC Function Outcomes: WOMAC function outcomes did not reach statistical significance when considering both Rotta and non-Rotta preparations.
• Radiological Progression: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to slow down the radiological progression of OA of the knee over three years, suggesting potential benefits in joint health and function.,• Overall Effect: The study found that glucosamine favored placebo with a 28% improvement in pain when considering all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine showed a significant reduction in pain compared to placebo. In contrast, non-Rotta preparations did not show a statistically significant effect on pain relief.
• Quality of Studies: When only considering studies with adequate allocation concealment, glucosamine did not show a significant benefit in reducing pain. • Comparison with NSAIDs: In some trials, the Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to be superior or equivalent to NSAIDs for pain relief.,Trials showed moderate to large effects of glucosamine and chondroitin preparations in alleviating osteoarthritis symptoms.,When glucosamine was compared to an NSAID in four RCTs, it was superior in two.,Glucosamine was found to be superior in treating OA when compared to placebo in all but one of the 13 RCTs.,People with knee osteoarthritis were given glucosamine and chondroitin to swallow. 📏 Results:
The variability in results, depending on the preparation of glucosamine and the quality of the studies, highlights the need for more consistent research in this area. (https://www.notion.so/The-variability-in-results-depending-on-the-preparation-of-glucosamine-and-the-quality-of-the-studi-9a30d2807b3642389e52c281e7252eb0?pvs=21), Trials showed moderate to large effects of glucosamine and chondroitin preparations in alleviating osteoarthritis symptoms. (https://www.notion.so/Trials-showed-moderate-to-large-effects-of-glucosamine-and-chondroitin-preparations-in-alleviating-o-dd2f92bd59fb4fb996a7df43e0e36601?pvs=21), • Overall Effect on Function: The study showed a 21% improvement in function using the Lequesne index across all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: Similar to pain, glucosamine in the Rotta preparation was more effective in improving joint function compared to placebo, as opposed to non-Rotta preparations.
• WOMAC Function Outcomes: WOMAC function outcomes did not reach statistical significance when considering both Rotta and non-Rotta preparations.
• Radiological Progression: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to slow down the radiological progression of OA of the knee over three years, suggesting potential benefits in joint health and function. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-on-Function-The-study-showed-a-21-improvement-in-function-using-the-Lequesne-index--642916c98d4e497eb75cb2c184afc252?pvs=21), • Overall Effect: The study found that glucosamine favored placebo with a 28% improvement in pain when considering all studies.
• Rotta vs. Non-Rotta Preparations: The Rotta preparation of glucosamine showed a significant reduction in pain compared to placebo. In contrast, non-Rotta preparations did not show a statistically significant effect on pain relief.
• Quality of Studies: When only considering studies with adequate allocation concealment, glucosamine did not show a significant benefit in reducing pain. • Comparison with NSAIDs: In some trials, the Rotta preparation of glucosamine was found to be superior or equivalent to NSAIDs for pain relief. (https://www.notion.so/Overall-Effect-The-study-found-that-glucosamine-favored-placebo-with-a-28-improvement-in-pain-when-341e14d16ca84133bb6803de294e4941?pvs=21), Trials showed moderate to large effects of glucosamine and chondroitin preparations in alleviating osteoarthritis symptoms. Label: In 20 young volunteers, taking grape extract capsules for 5 days increased their blood's antioxidant activity but didn't change their vitamin C and E levels.,Following GSE, significant changes were noted in whole blood GSH (reduced glutathione), which is a marker of oxidative stress. The whole blood GSH levels increased from 2359 +/- 823 mmol/l to 3595 +/- 1051 mmol/l (P < 0.01).,Following GSE (Grape Seed Extract), significant changes were noted in hsCRP (highly sensitive C-reactive protein), which is a marker of inflammation. The hsCRP levels decreased from 3.2 +/- 3.65 mg/l to 2.0 +/- 2.2 mg/l (P = 0.0006).,The antioxidant potential of grape seed extract polyphenols may prove effective in a model of oxidative stress (smoking); however more investigational data are needed before use in wider clinical settings.

Label:
The study reported significant reductions in oxidative state and sensitivity to oxidation of serum lipids after pomegranate juice consumption (P < 0.02), indicating a beneficial impact on oxidative stress.,1. 12% decrease in cell proliferation: This means that after the patients drank pomegranate juice, the rate at which prostate cancer cells (LNCaP cells) were growing decreased by 12%. In other words, the cancer cells were multiplying slower.
2. 17% increase in apoptosis: Apoptosis is a fancy term for the process of cells dying in a controlled manner, which is a normal and healthy function in the body. This part of the result shows that there was a 17% increase in the death of cancer cells after the patients consumed pomegranate juice. This is generally a good thing because it means the body is getting rid of the harmful cancer cells more effectively.
3. 23% increase in serum nitric oxide: Nitric oxide in the blood can be beneficial because it helps with blood flow and can have anti-inflammatory effects. A 23% increase indicates that pomegranate juice might help improve blood circulation.
📄 Papers: Phase II study of pomegranate juice for men with rising prostate-specific antigen following surgery or radiation for prostate cancer (https://www.notion.so/Phase-II-study-of-pomegranate-juice-for-men-with-rising-prostate-specific-antigen-following-surgery--220d4561b8ad4e47945341de2d2c8722?pvs=21)

Label: The present study suggests that the ability of tart cherry juice to reduce systolic BP and LDL cholesterol, in part, may be due to its anti-oxidative and anti-inflammatory properties.,The study observed a reduction in the mean c-reactive protein (CRP) level after the 12-week intervention with tart cherry juice compared to the control group. CRP is a well-known biomarker of inflammation, and a reduction in its levels is indicative of decreased inflammation in the body.,The study found that tart cherry juice significantly increased the plasma levels of DNA repair activity of 8-oxoguanine glycosylase. This suggests that the consumption of tart cherry juice may have a role in repairing DNA damage, as the increased activity of 8-oxoguanine glycosylase is associated with the repair of damaged DNA.,We conclude that a tart cherry juice concentrate rich in anthocyanins has no effect on arterial stiffness, c-reactive protein and risk markers for cardiovascular disease, but evokes a minor increase in antioxidant status in healthy adults.,We conclude that a tart cherry juice concentrate rich in anthocyanins has no effect on arterial stiffness, c-reactive protein and risk markers for cardiovascular disease, but evokes a minor increase in antioxidant status in healthy adults.,This suggests that Montmorency tart cherry consumption, both alone and in combination with exercise, statistically improved oxidative stress markers following a high-fat meal.,The study reports a reduction in total antioxidant status (TAS) (P = 0.036) from mid- to post-supplementation with MTCJ.
